SEARCH
Package de.happybavarian07.coolstufflib.languagemanager.expressionengine

Klasse ExpressionEngine

java.lang.Object
de.happybavarian07.coolstufflib.languagemanager.expressionengine.ExpressionEngine
public class ExpressionEngine extends Object
A modern implementation of the conditional expression parser using a lexer/parser/interpreter pattern. This provides better handling of nested conditions and more efficient parsing.

The ExpressionParser combines the Lexer, Parser, and Interpreter components to provide a complete pipeline for evaluating expressions within language files. It supports:

  • Mathematical expressions (e.g., "2 + 3 * 4")
  • Logical expressions (e.g., "value > 10 && isAdmin")
  • Conditional chains (e.g., "if condition: valueA elif otherCondition: valueB else: valueC")
  • Function calls (e.g., "Out(STONE)")
  • Variable references

This parser is particularly useful for dynamic content in language files, allowing for conditional rendering and computation based on runtime context.

Seit:
2025-05-24
Autor:
HappyBavarian07

  • Methodendetails

    • registerFunction

      public void registerFunction(String name, FunctionCall functionCall)
      Registers a function with the expression parser.

      Registered functions can be called from within expressions using the syntax: functionName(arg1, arg2, ...)

      Parameter:
      name - The name of the function to register
      functionCall - The implementation of the function

    • registerFunction

      public void registerFunction(String name, FunctionCall functionCall, String defaultType)
      Registers a function with the expression parser with a default type parameter.

      Registered functions can be called from within expressions using the syntax: functionName(arg1, arg2, ...) or functionName<Type>(arg1, arg2, ...)

      If the function is called without an explicit type parameter, the default type will be used.

      Parameter:
      name - The name of the function to register
      functionCall - The implementation of the function
      defaultType - The default type parameter to use when not specified in the call

    • registerFunction

      public void registerFunction(String name, FunctionCall functionCall, String defaultType, Class<?>[] argTypes, Class<?> returnType)
      Registers a function with argument and return type information.
      Parameter:
      name - The function name
      functionCall - The implementation
      defaultType - The default type parameter
      argTypes - Argument types (null for any)
      returnType - Return type (null for any)

      public LanguageFunctionManager getFunctionManager()
      Returns the function manager for this expression parser.

      The function manager provides additional utilities for registering and managing functions that can be called from expressions.

      Gibt zurück:
      The associated LanguageFunctionManager instance

    • parse

      public MaterialCondition parse(String expression, org.bukkit.Material defaultMaterial)
      Parses an expression that returns a material with potential head texture support.

      This method extends the standard material parsing to include support for custom player heads with texture values. The syntax for a head material is: HEAD('player_name') or HEAD_TEXTURE('base64_value')

      Parameter:
      expression - The expression to parse
      defaultMaterial - The default material to return if parsing fails
      Gibt zurück:
      A MaterialCondition or HeadMaterial representing the result

    • parse

      public <T> T parse(String expression, Class<T> type)
      Parses an expression and returns the result of its evaluation with type conversion.

      This method evaluates an expression and attempts to convert the result to the specified type. It supports parsing direct values (like material names) as well as complex expressions including conditional chains and function calls.

      Example usage: 

       // Parse a direct material
 Material material = parser.parse("DIAMOND_BLOCK", Material.class);

 // Parse a conditional expression returning a string
 String message = parser.parse(
     "if player.level > 10: 'High level player' else: 'Low level player'",
     String.class
 );

 // Parse a numeric expression
 Double value = parser.parse("2 * (3 + 4)", Double.class);
      Typparameter:
      T - the expected return type
      Parameter:
      expression - the expression to parse
      type - the class object representing the expected return type
      Gibt zurück:
      the parsed expression result converted to type T
      Löst aus:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the expression is invalid or cannot be parsed, or if the result cannot be converted to the specified type

      public String validate(String expression)
      Validates the syntax of an expression without evaluating it. Returns null if valid, or an error message if invalid.
      Parameter:
      expression - The expression to validate.
      Gibt zurück:
      Null if valid, otherwise an error message.

    • setDebugMode

      public void setDebugMode(boolean enabled)
      Enables or disables debug/trace mode for this engine. When enabled, each evaluation step is logged to the console.
      Parameter:
      enabled - True to enable debug mode, false to disable.

    • evaluate

      public Object evaluate(String expression)
      Evaluates an expression string and returns the result.
      Parameter:
      expression - the expression to evaluate
      Gibt zurück:
      the result of evaluation
      Löst aus:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the expression is invalid or cannot be parsed

    • setStrictMode

      public void setStrictMode(boolean enabled)
      Enables or disables strict mode for the parser.

      In strict mode, the parser enforces stricter rules on the syntax and semantics of expressions. This may include restrictions on variable usage, function calls, and type conversions.

      Parameter:
      enabled - True to enable strict mode, false to disable.

    • isStrictMode

      public boolean isStrictMode()
      Returns whether strict mode is enabled.
      Gibt zurück:
      True if strict mode is enabled, false otherwise.

    • setMaxRecursionDepth

      public void setMaxRecursionDepth(int maxDepth)
      Sets the maximum depth for recursive expressions.

      This prevents stack overflow errors in cases of deeply nested or recursive expressions.

      Parameter:
      maxDepth - The maximum depth (default is 100)

    • getMaxRecursionDepth

      public int getMaxRecursionDepth()
      Gets the current maximum depth for recursive expressions.
      Gibt zurück:
      The maximum depth

    • setEvaluationTimeout

      public void setEvaluationTimeout(int timeoutMillis)
      Sets the timeout for expression evaluation in milliseconds.

      If an expression exceeds this time limit, it will be terminated and an exception will be thrown.

      Parameter:
      timeoutMillis - The timeout in milliseconds

    • getEvaluationTimeout

      public int getEvaluationTimeout()
      Gets the current timeout for expression evaluation.
      Gibt zurück:
      The timeout in milliseconds

    • registerVariableType

      public void registerVariableType(String name, Class<?> clazz)
      Registers a custom variable type with the engine.

      This allows expressions to use custom objects and types beyond the built-in ones.

      Parameter:
      name - The name of the variable type
      clazz - The class object representing the variable type

    • registerFunctionType

      public void registerFunctionType(String name, Class<?> clazz)
      Registers a custom function type with the engine.

      This allows expressions to use custom functions with specific signatures and behaviors.

      Parameter:
      name - The name of the function type
      clazz - The class object representing the function type

    • setErrorHandler

      public void setErrorHandler(java.util.function.BiConsumer<ExpressionEngine,Exception> handler)
      Sets a custom error handler for the expression engine.

      The error handler is called when an error occurs during parsing or evaluation of expressions.

      Parameter:
      handler - The error handler function

      Parameter:
